    • Method Detail

      • replaceTokensWithValues

        public String replaceTokensWithValues(String queryString,
                             Map<String,Object> params)
                               throws org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException
        Replaces a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} with the values from the passed in map, where the token-name must be the key in the map
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with tokens
        params - the parameters to replace the tokens. Values can be String or List.
        Returns:
        the query with all tokens replace with their found values
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if token in the query is not in the passed parameters

      • replaceTokens

        public String replaceTokens(String queryString,
                   String replacement)
        Replaces a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} with the specified replacement string for all tokens.
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with tokens to replace
        replacement - the replacement string
        Returns:
        the query with all tokens replaced

      • replaceTokens

        public String replaceTokens(String queryString,
                   String replacement,
                   String... nonReplacementTokenPrefixes)
        Replaces a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} with the specified replacement string for all tokens.
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with tokens to replace
        replacement - the replacement string
        nonReplacementTokenPrefixes - optional array of prefixes that, if found as part of a token, will not be replaced
        Returns:
        the query with all tokens replaced

      • extractTokens

        public List<String> extractTokens(String queryString)
        Extracts all the token names in the query string of format ${token-name}
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with tokens
        Returns:
        the list of token names, in the order they appear in the queryString

      • replaceSomeTokens

        public String replaceSomeTokens(String queryString,
                       Map<String,String> replacements)
        Replaces some tokens in a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} with the given replacements, which may again be tokens (e.g. in another format) or values. Tokens that have no replacement defined stay in the original token format.
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with OpenIDM format tokens ${token}
        replacements - the replacement values/tokens, where the key is the token name in the query string, and the value is the String to replace it with.
        Returns:
        the query with any defined replacement values/tokens replaced, and the remaining tokens left in the original format

      • replaceListTokens

        public String replaceListTokens(String queryString,
                       Map<String,Integer> numberOfReplacements,
                       String replacement)
        Replaces some tokens in a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} where token-name represents a list of values. The numberOfReplacements Map tells how many replacements to produce (comma-separated) for each token. The replacement (for all tokens) is provided. Tokens that have no replacement defined stay in the original token format.
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with OpenIDM format tokens ${token}
        numberOfReplacements - the number of replacements to replace a ${token} with
        replacement - the replacement values/tokens
        Returns:
        the query with any defined replacement values/tokens replaced, and the remaining tokens left in the original format

      • replaceTokensWithOrientToken

        public String replaceTokensWithOrientToken(String queryString)
        Replaces a query string with tokens of format ${token-name} with the token format in OrientDB, which is of the form :token-name. OrientDB tokens has some limitations, e.g. they can currently only be used in the where clause, and hence the returned string is not guaranteed to be valid for use in a prepared statement. If the parsing fails the system may have to fall back onto non-prepared statements and manual token replacement.
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query with OpenIDM format tokens ${token}
        Returns:
        the query with all tokens replaced with the OrientDB style tokens :token
